channel.title: Favourite dating spots?
channel.description:
I've run out of things do to on first or second dates, so I was wondering what you guys normally choose for the date. I work at the movies, so that's not really a good first date, would make me out to be a cheap ass (free movies), and just hanging out isn't usually the best first date. Where do you take them?
-Holic

item.title: Favourite dating spots?
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

I would have to say that the movies would be the most enjoyable. Either that or the mall or a coffee shop like others have suggested. Pretty much anything is fine, as long as it isn’t going to be boring for her.

item.title: Favourite dating spots?

item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Well if I’m six I don’t know how to spell? Possibly? I’m surprised you didn’t catch this.

That is the most blatant and pathetic coverup I have ever seen. What have you actually contributed to the community again?
[/quote]
Well this isn’t an Anti Leech community so it doesn’t matter really whether he has or hasn’t contributed to the community, but I do agree he is getting annoying.[/quote]
If being Anti Leech allows you to make useless uninformative posts, I think that contradicts another rule.

Anyway, as JME said, going skiing or snowboarding on a date is really quite enjoyable, especially if you’re good at it.

item.title: Favourite dating spots?
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

frank_:

that logic is flawed on so many levels

I don’t really know how to explain it properly, but I’m sure you know what I’m saying.
If you invite someone to go out for a restaurant, date or not, it’s normally you’re treating them. Same goes with dates.

jme: That’s how I end up going to coffee shops

-Holic

Read full topic

@jme wrote:

I’d say the movies, and the ski hill are the most popular here.

Half the time you just ask her out, then you guys figure out what to do later. I dunno.

item.title: Favourite dating spots?
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

The only place I’d ever go on a date is a coffee shop. Why? Because I might get some free coffee out of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Favourite dating spots?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

What’s with people “dating”? I get to know a person before i go around trying to get in a relationship. I’d say become friends and let it take maybe 1-2 months. By then you should be confident enough to discuss a relationship.

Read full topic

item.title: Favourite dating spots?
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

I know money doesn’t have to be spent, but taking them on a date to somewhere that normally costs money, but you get in free, is like you’re not too interested in them. After that, sure you can have all the free dates but on the first one, at least, I feel you should a little bit of money because it does show you’re interested in them because if you weren’t, why the hell would you pay for them?
Doesn’t mean you have to go all out.

I’ve also done the coffee shop date a lot which does work out pretty well and even better if you know them as a friend before hand. I guess I could go for that one one more time.

-Holic

Read full topic

item.title: Favourite dating spots?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:7, topic:198216”]Movie’s is my favorite option.
If you don’t like them you don’t have to talk, it removes awkward situations whereas you can pretend you’re interested and if you do like them… well, it’s dark.

Good first date.[/quote]
about the “Well, it’s dark.” thing:
Cinema’s here are like made so you cannot even lean over and put you arm around someone, its freakin annoying. Its still a good way to spend a date, you don’t have to be that social + get to watcha hopefully enjoyable movie.

Read full topic

My first date was at a cafe in a shopping mall but yeh birthdays an christmas oh and valentines day are the onl times really to spend money on a girl

item.title: Favourite dating spots?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

TBH me and my gf find it hard to find stuff to do. We are not the type of people who will go to the park and sit there for hours(As I have done with previous gf’s with friends around). Plus we aren’t old enough to do more adult stuff such as driving places or going in to pubs&clubs.

You could just go like shopping or something and grab a coffee at a coffee bar or something?

Read full topic

item.title: Favourite dating spots?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Cheap ass? Thats a myth. If you spend money on a girl that pretty much tell her: “I’m insecure so I’ll buy you stuff so you like me, sex please?”

I’m not saying I’m a complete stud, but I do know a fair bit about getting girls, and I know spending money isn’t one of them. The only money I spend on girls usually are bday and xmas pressents for girlfriends.

It really doesn’t matter where the date is, it’s your personality that gets the attraction.

Read full topic
